pause","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"success","type":"bool"}],"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"kind":"dev","methods":{"addVesting(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"adds a vesting grant initiated by this contract as manager","params":{"beneficiary":": beneficiary address","cliffPeriod":": initial waiting period","instalmentAmount":": installment amount","instalmentCount":": instalment count","instalmentPeriod":": instalment period","startTime":": start time"}},"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-allowance}."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"checkInflation()":{"details":"checks the inflation and sets the inflation parameters if the inflation cycle has changed"},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"getInflation()":{"details":"returns the properties pertaining to inflation"},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"initialize(address,address,address,address,address,address,address,address,address,address,address,address,address)":{"details":"Constructor for initializing the PSTAKE contract.","params":{"airdropPool":"- address of the airdrop pool.","alphaLaunchpadPool":"- address of the alpha launchpad pool.","communityDevelopmentFundPool":"- address of the community development fund pool.","incentivisationPool":"- address of the incentivising pool.","protocolTreasuryPool":"- address of the protocol treasury pool.","publicSalePool1":"- address of the public sale pool1.","publicSalePool2":"- address of the public sale pool2.","publicSalePool3":"- address of the public sale pool3.","retroactiveRewardProtocolBootstrapPool":"- address of the retroactive reward protocol bootstrap pool.","seedSalePool":"- address of the seed sale pool.","teamPool":"- address of the team pool.","vestingTimelockAddress":"- address of the vesting timelock contract.","xprtStakersPool":"- address of the xprt stakers pool."}},"mint(address,uint256)":{"details":"Mint new PSTAKE for the provided 'address' and 'amount' Emits a {Transfer} event with 'to' set to address and 'tokens' set to amount of tokens. Requirements: - `amount` cannot be less than zero."},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"pause()":{"details":"Triggers stopped state. Requirements: - The contract must not be paused."},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"setInflation(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Set inflation","params":{"inflationPeriod":": inflation cycle in seconds Emits a {SetInflationRate} event.","inflationRate":": inflation rate given as value between 0 and 100"}},"setSupplyMaxLimit(uint256)":{"details":"Set supply max limit of the inflation component","params":{"supplyMaxLimit":": supply max limit value Emits a {SetSupplyMaxLimit} event."}},"setVestingTimelockContract(address)":{"details":"Set 'contract address', called from constructor","params":{"vestingTimelockAddress":": Vesting timelock contract address Emits a {SetVestingTimelockContract} event with '_contract' set to the VestingTimelockcontract address."}},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`."},"unpause()":{"details":"Returns to normal state. Requirements: - The contract must be paused."}},"stateVariables":{"_lastInflationBlockTime":{"details":"getter method created from variable definition"},"_supplyMaxLimit":{"details":"getter method documentation.text:
@dev Check inflation
 Emits a {CheckInflation} event with 'block height', 'inflationComponent', and 'timestamp'.
@dev checks the inflation and sets the inflation parameters if the inflation cycle has changed
@dev returns the properties pertaining to inflation

@dev Mint new PSTAKE for the provided 'address' and 'amount'
 Emits a {Transfer} event with 'to' set to address and 'tokens' set to amount of tokens.
 Requirements:
 - `amount` cannot be less than zero.

@dev Hook that is called before any transfer of tokens. This includes
 minting and burning.
 Calling conditions:
 - when `from` and `to` are both non-zero, `amount` of ``from``'s tokens
 will be to transferred to `to`.
 - when `from` is zero, `amount` tokens will be minted for `to`.
 - when `to` is zero, `amount` of ``from``'s tokens will be burned.
 - `from` and `to` are never both zero.

attributes.text:
@dev Check inflation
 Emits a {CheckInflation} event with 'block height', 'inflationComponent', and 'timestamp'.
@dev checks the inflation and sets the inflation parameters if the inflation cycle has changed
@dev returns the properties pertaining to inflation

@dev Mint new PSTAKE for the provided 'address' and 'amount'
 Emits a {Transfer} event with 'to' set to address and 'tokens' set to amount of tokens.
 Requirements:
 - `amount` cannot be less than zero.

@dev Hook that is called before any transfer of tokens. This includes
 minting and burning.
 Calling conditions:
 - when `from` and `to` are both non-zero, `amount` of ``from``'s tokens
 will be to transferred to `to`.
 - when `from` is zero, `amount` tokens will be minted for `to`.
 - when `to` is zero, `amount` of ``from``'s tokens will be burned.
 - `from` and `to` are never both zero.

addVesting(address,uint256,uint256,uint2.details: adds a vesting grant initiated by this contract as manager

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

checkInflation().details: checks the inflation and sets the inflation parameters if the inflation cycle has changed

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

getInflation().details: returns the properties pertaining to inflation

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

initialize(address,address,address,addre.details: Constructor for initializing the PSTAKE contract.

params.alphaLaunchpadPool: - address of the alpha launchpad pool.
params.communityDevelopmentFundPool: - address of the community development fund pool.
params.protocolTreasuryPool: - address of the protocol treasury pool.
params.publicSalePool1: - address of the public sale pool1.
params.publicSalePool2: - address of the public sale pool2.
params.publicSalePool3: - address of the public sale pool3.
params.retroactiveRewardProtocolBootstrapPool: - address of the retroactive reward protocol bootstrap pool.
params.seedSalePool: - address of the seed sale pool.
params.vestingTimelockAddress: - address of the vesting timelock contract.
params.xprtStakersPool: - address of the xprt stakers pool.

mint(address,uint256).details: Mint new PSTAKE for the provided 'address' and 'amount' Emits a {Transfer} event with 'to' set to address and 'tokens' set to amount of tokens. Requirements: - `amount` cannot be less than zero.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

pause().details: Triggers stopped state. Requirements: - The contract must not be paused.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params.inflationPeriod: : inflation cycle in seconds Emits a {SetInflationRate} event.
params.inflationRate: : inflation rate given as value between 0 and 100

setSupplyMaxLimit(uint256).details: Set supply max limit of the inflation component

params.supplyMaxLimit: : supply max limit value Emits a {SetSupplyMaxLimit} event.

params.vestingTimelockAddress: : Vesting timelock contract address Emits a {SetVestingTimelockContract} event with '_contract' set to the VestingTimelockcontract address.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

unpause().details: Returns to normal state. Requirements: - The contract must be paused.

_lastInflationBlockTime.details: getter method created from variable definition

_supplyMaxLimit.details: getter method created from variable definition

_totalInflatedSupply.details: getter method created from variable definition
